page.title: 11Kimbolton - Hamlets
page.content: {Stonely}has always been the home of the farmers who worked the open fields at the east end of the parish.There are fewer farmers today,but most of them live in Stonely.However ,the majority of the small-holdings have exclusive houses on them now,and attractive flower gardens have replaced the vegetable plots. {Newtown,}first mentioned in 1279,appears to be a failed medieval expansion. Its population remained small until the last century when it housed mostly artisans and agricultural labourers. This relatively humble origin is being transformed at present with the steady introduction of executive housing. {Wornditch}has shrunk from what was probably a separate estate of perhaps twenty families in the Middle Ages,to three houses today.
